sections.heading: Any area within the boundaries of a single county may be
sections.text: incorporated as a cemetery maintenance district in the manner following:

sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Cemetery Maintenance District Act.

sections.heading: All courts in this State shall take judicial notice of the
sections.text:
existence of all cemetery maintenance districts organized under this Act
and every such district shall constitute a body corporate and politic and
as such may sue or be sued.

sections.heading: A board of trustees consisting of 3 members for the government and
sections.text:
control of the affairs and business of a cemetery maintenance district
incorporated under this act shall be determined in the following manner:

sections.heading: Whenever a vacancy in the board of trustees occurs, either by death,
sections.text:
resignation, refusal to qualify or for any other reason, the appropriate
appointing authority, as defined in Section 3 of this Act shall fill such
vacancy by appointment for the unexpired term; and such person so appointed
shall qualify for office in the manner hereinbefore stated and shall
thereupon assume the duties of the office.

sections.heading: (a) The trustees shall exercise all of the powers and control all the
sections.text:
affairs of such district. The board of trustees, immediately after their
appointment and at their first meeting in May of each year thereafter,
shall elect one of their number as president and one of their number as
secretary. The board shall prescribe the duties and fix the compensation of
all of the officers and employees of the cemetery maintenance district; but
no member of the board of trustees shall receive a sum to exceed $50.00 per
annum. The board of trustees shall have full power to pass all necessary
ordinances, rules and regulations for the proper management and conduct of
the business of the cemetery maintenance district for carrying into effect
the objects for which the district was formed.

sections.heading: All ordinances imposing any penalty or making any appropriations
sections.text:
shall be published at least once in a newspaper published in said district,
or if no newspaper of general circulation is published therein, by posting
copies of the same in 10 public places in the district; and no such
ordinance shall take effect until 10 days after it is so published or
posted, and all other ordinances and resolutions shall take effect from and
after their passage unless otherwise provided therein.

sections.heading: All ordinances, orders, and resolutions and the date of publication
sections.text:
thereof, may be proven by the certificate of the secretary under the seal
of the district and when printed in book or pamphlet form and purporting to
be published by the board of trustees, such book or pamphlet shall be
received as evidence of the passage and legal publication of such
ordinances, orders and resolutions as of the dates mentioned in such book
or pamphlet, in all courts without further proof.

sections.heading: A cemetery maintenance district may rehabilitate, recondition and
sections.text:
restore any neglected or abandoned publicly owned cemetery within the
district and may thereafter maintain any such cemetery in good condition.

sections.heading: The board of trustees may receive, in trust, from the proprietors
sections.text:
or owners of any lot in any cemetery which it maintains or from any person
interested in the maintenance of such a cemetery, any gift or
legacy of money or property of a value of $50 or more which
may be donated
to such board for the maintenance of such lot or cemetery. The board has
the right to convert any property so received into money. The board may use
all such money, or the income thereof, as may be specified by the terms of
the donor in making the gift or legacy.

sections.heading: The Board of trustees may levy taxes for corporate purposes upon all
sections.text:
taxable property within the territorial limits of such cemetery
maintenance district, the aggregate amount of which for each year shall
not exceed .06% of value of such property, as equalized or assessed by
the Department of Revenue.

sections.heading: Purchases made pursuant to this Act shall be made in
sections.text:
compliance with the "Local Government Prompt Payment Act", approved by the
Eighty-fourth General Assembly.

sections.heading: Transfer of funds.
sections.text:
When a cemetery maintenance district takes
over a cemetery or cemetery authority, the care fund of the cemetery or
cemetery authority
shall be transferred into the cemetery maintenance district's care fund.

sections.heading: Cessation of district organization
